Literature Review: Deep generative models (DGMs) have revolutionized the field of genomics by enabling researchers to learn complex structures in genomic data and generate novel genomic instances that retain real characteristics of the original dataset. This review aims to provide an overview of DGMs in functional and evolutionary genomics, highlighting their applications, challenges, and future directions.
